item.title: Housing | Raymond Tam guarantees T2 and T3 construction
item.description:
The secretary admits that the government's goal is to create a permanent candidacy mechanism for the purchase of economic housing and allow families with small houses to move to others
The Secretary for Transport and Public Works, Raymond Tam, guaranteed yesterday that the public housing policy will have as a priority the construction of apartments T2 and T3. The promise was left yesterday in the Legislative Assembly, where he was answering the questions of the deputies. "In the future public housing policy we will consider the construction of more dwellings T2 and T3," said Raymond Tam, after being confronted with the fact that these are the type of housing most sought after by the population. The secretary acknowledged that currently part of the population living in economic housing has to deal with the fact that apartments sold if they have become too small with the growth of families. Economic housing is a type of housing sold to people at more affordable prices compared to those practiced on the market. However, before you can advance with the construction of more houses, Raymond Tam acknowledged that the short -term solution will have to create a mechanism where families living in a T1 or T2 will be able to exchange for more rooms. “In the short term, to solve the problem, we can allow the exchange of fractions for the larger ones. It is a measure that can be taken in the short term and we expect to improve housing conditions in both social and economic housing, ”said Tam. Social housing is another type of public housing for disadvantaged families, which are leased by the public administration with more affordable prices than those practiced in the private market. Price Changes Throughout the session, and with changes in the private market, where prices are increasingly cheaper, deputies such as Leong Sun IOK, linked to the Federation of Macao Workers Associations (Faom), suggested a reduction in economic housing prices. "Currently, the price of private and public housing is practically the same, and this influences the desire to buy," said Leong. “Economic housing can only be sold in the market after 16 years, and at limited prices, so it should have affordable prices. I ask the government to make an assessment of the prices currently practiced, ”he said. A similar request was presented by Deputy Ron Lam: "We have to take into account the situation of the real estate market that is also undergoing changes," he said. In turn, Raymond Tam replied that the offer of housing in zone A of new landfills will take into account the changes in the market, and ensured that any changes are “being analyzed”. Regarding the possibility of a permanent mechanism for buying economic housing, instead of residents are limited to the opening of competitions by the government, TAM promised that this will be the situation in the future. However, plans should take time to be implemented due to the lack of available houses.

item.title: APN | Sam Hou Fai met with representatives of Macau

In the Sam Hou Fai speech, he appealed to the representatives to present the advantages and needs of Macao “in the new development” to make a “greater contribution to the construction of a strong country”, “revitalization of the nation” and “Macao Progress”. Sam Hou Fai also assured that the Government of MSar people pay “high tribute to all Macao deputies to APN and Macao members in the CCPPC National Committee for participation in the country's governance, promoting the development of Macao, for the reflection on feelings and opinions of the people and the congregation of patriotic love ”. Candidate with memory According to the official government statement, Sam Hou Fai thanked the “attention and support” of local representatives during the “candidacy for the position of the Chief Executive” and “in the organization of the new government”. Internally, the ruler appealed to representatives who contribute to “valuable suggestions and strong support” to the elaboration of the “governing lines of action for this year”, the first of this executive, which should be presented in the coming weeks. item.title: Burla | PJ Alerts for false ads with deputies
item.description: The Judicial Police (PJ) yesterday informed the public about the existence of false investment announcements on social networks involving public figures, namely the business and political environment, such as Kevin Ho, a member of Macao to the national and nephew popular assembly of Edmund Ho; Angela Leong, deputy and businesswoman linked to the Macao Game Society, and Deputy Chui Sai Peng. According to a PJ note released yesterday, these false announcements resort to these personalities to advertise easy profits “through certain investment platforms, inducing citizens to click on links that lead them to fake investment platforms to register accounts”. In this way, the burns end up stealing personal data and withdrawing money from the accounts of the victims. The PJ also warns of “increasing investment fraud cases in recent years, where burns turn to social networking platforms to attract victims”. Thus, with “various strategies, they promote investment plans advertising high returns”. At first, “some victims can make small profits and make such gains surveys successfully, but by increasing the value of the investment, they find that they fail to raise the money, realizing that they were deceived,” describes PJ.

item.title: Economy | China growth is an opportunity for PLP
item.description: The Secretary-General of the Forum for Economic and Commercial Cooperation between China and Portuguese-speaking countries (PLP) yesterday defended that Chinese economic growth will create opportunities for the Lusophone bloc. “China remains a major engine of world economic growth with good cooperation prospects with Portuguese -speaking countries,” said Ji Xianzheng at the Macao Forum New Year's reception. China's economic growth reached in 2024 the 5 percent goal set by Beijing, but some analysts claim that the economy is expanding at a slower pace than indicated in official estimates. In a report released on January 16, the World Bank predicted that the world economy is expected to grow 2.7 percent by 2025 and 2026 and said that slowdown in the United States and China is weighing on global growth. In a speech, Ji Xianzheng said that "Macao's efforts" at the opening abroad "will certainly bring new opportunities for China and Portuguese -speaking countries in the face of deepening cooperation in various domains." In April last year, the Macao Forum held the sixth ministerial conference, during which a new action plan was approved by 2027, focused on new cooperation areas, such as the digital economy and the blue economy. Despite the optimism, Ji Xianzheng stressed that “the promotion of a comprehensive cooperation of mutual benefits with Portuguese -speaking countries is pending the joint efforts of the ten countries” that are part of the Macao Forum. The organization has as members Angola, Brazil, Cape Verde, Guinea-Bissau, Mozambique, Portugal, Timor-Leste, Sao Tome and Principe (since 2017) and Equatorial Guinea (since 2022). Aligned government The Macao Forum was established in 2003, the same year when Beijing designated the city as a platform for reinforcing economic and commercial cooperation between China and Portuguese -speaking countries. In the same ceremony, the chief executive of the region promised to “fully support” the organization, to take advantage of “the unique advantages” of the city and “effectively enhance Macau as an interlocutor between China and Portuguese -speaking countries”. Sam Hou Fai has assured that Macau will “reinforce bilateral opening with Lusophone countries”, as well as “take a more open and inclusive posture to intensify international ties and increase global projection and attractiveness”. Sam Hou Fai, who took office on December 20, is the first leader of the Macao government who dominates the Portuguese language.

item.title: Economy | CE Alert for International Instability Risks
item.description:

However, Sam Hou Fai is confident that "in the long run the economy of the interior of China and the country's economy ship will certainly sail in the wind and break the waves for a brighter future." To circumvent economic difficulties, the ruler pointed to the fulfillment of the objectives set by the central government for the MSAR, not defrauding the expectations of President XI Jinping to the territory. "The great homeland is always our firm support and, 'support of the country and interconnection with the world' are undoubtedly the greatest advantages of MSAR," said Sam Hou Fai.

item.title: Sam Hou Fai and Wu Sui
item.description: Everyone knows who Sam Hou Fai is, but Wu Sui, does anyone know who it is? I believe not only most Portuguese, but also many Chinese have never heard this name. However, in Chinese society, especially in Macao where popular beliefs are preserved, Wu Sui is an important figure because it is an “guardian deity” of the year of the serpent, responsible for supervising the happiness and misfortune of the human world. Wu Sui was born in China 800 years ago during the Song Dynasty and served as a magistrate in Xuning County. During his mandate, Wu Sui exposed many hidden crimes and the neighboring neighbors often sought their help and advice to solve difficult cases. One year, there was a great drought and Wu Sui prayed in the temple for three days and three nights and ended up raining. To relieve the drought's impact on the people, Wu decreed the tax reduction and the rental of the land, providing help to 48,000 victims of this disaster. At that time, more than 400,000 refugees from other affected areas crossed the river to Xiuning and Wu Sui did all possible to help them. While other cities were immersed in chaos due to incidents of agitation, set fire, and withdrawals motivated by drought, the areas governed by Wu Sui remained peaceful and orderly, without anyone creating any problem. Therefore, it is not without reason that popular tradition elected Wu as the guardian divinity in the year of the serpent. Due to the current complex and constantly changing international developments, it is believed that 2025 will be a year that happens once in every century and will have to face great challenges. Although crises and opportunities are hand in hand, not all leaders know how to “recognize change”, “respond to change” and “seek change”. Recently, Xia Baolong, the director of the Hong Kong and Macao work office and the Hong Kong and Macao affairs office with the Council of State, visited the deepened cooperation zone between Guangdong and Macau in Hengqin, the cooperation zone and Technological and scientific innovation of Hetao Shenzhen-Hong Kong (Hetao Cooperation Zone), Modern Service Industry Zone between Qianhai district in Shenzhen and Hong Kong and the port of Yantian, where he was deeply involved in talks with employees responsible to strengthen cooperation between Guangdong, Hong Kong and Macau and to promote the best integration of these cities in the Great Guangdong-Macau Bay. Hong Kong and Macao, in conjunction with Guangzhou and Shenzhen, were once seen as the four engines of the development of the Great Guangdong-Macau Bay. However, due to several factors, Hong Kong is still in the “transition from stability to prosperity” while “1+4” diversification in Macau is, for now, in an embryonic phase. If the Government of the MSAR cannot deal with cautious diversification, it will not be able to produce synergies in the Great Guangdong-Macau Bay, but, on the contrary, the status of Macao will endangered as a potential international financial center and as a center World Tourism and Leisure World. Therefore, director Xia is very concerned about the future development of Hong Kong and Macao. Since Sam Hou Fai took office as chief executive, it is believed that his habit of “streets” has been changed, becoming more complicated for him to learn about the difficulties that the local population faces every day, related to The lack of employment and the closure of stores due to the breach of consumption. In addition to the fall in property prices, the cost of living is constantly increasing and radio programs are often heard from people asking the social risk value and old age pension to be increased. The beautiful idea of ​​“integration of Macao and Hengqin” cannot improve the current living level of short -term Macao residents. In the next lines of governing governing for the financial year of 2025, I sincerely hope that the government is actually concerned with the issues with which citizens have to deal with daily. Sam Hou Fai passed from the judge of the last court, the Chief Executive, while Wu Sui moved as a magistrate to be a guardian deity of the popular tradition. However, both were confronted with the challenge of finding solutions to relieve the difficulties that people have to face.

item.title: Geogostronomy and the role of Portuguese cuisine in Macau
item.description: “Macau’s Food Culture is a fascinating amalgamation of flavors Brought together by centuries of trade and colonial Rule. The Portuguese influence is particularly evident in dishes that combine local ingredients with techniques and recipes brought from Portugal. ” Macau’s Culinary Delights: Portuguese and Chinese Fusion BARKER, Anthony The intersection between geography and gastronomy, designated by geogostronomy, illustrates the significant influence of the place on culinary practices. Macau's Portuguese cuisine encompasses a unique mixture of culinary traditions, innovative practices and cultural exchanges that evolved from Portuguese influences and local ingredients. At the heart of Macanese cuisine is its historical framing. The gastronomic identity of Macao emerges from historical ties with Portugal, especially from the mid -16th century. The Portuguese presence in Asia began a cultural and culinary exchange that led to the development of unique dishes. This connection has established a platform for the culinary exchange not only between Portuguese and Chinese kitchens, but also with flavors from other regions, such as India and Southeast Asia. Thus, the origins of Macanese cuisine can be attributed to this intercultural integration, shaped by the availability of local ingredients and the migration of peoples. The introduction of ingredients such as turmeric, chilli and potatoes transformed the local kitchen. Traditional Portuguese recipes were adapted to local tastes and available resources, thus creating a distinct culinary hybrid. During the period of colonization, the Portuguese in Macao established a vibrant commercial port, facilitating trade between Europe and Asia. This trade brought not only exotic ingredients, but also several culinary techniques that formed the backbone of Macau's cuisine. The mixture of flavors of Portuguese, Chinese and Asian influences contributed to the richness of Macao's culinary supply. Macau's cuisine scene has been shaped by several chefs that have been at the forefront of promoting traditional Portuguese dishes cast with local influences. Its approach exemplifies the culmination of Portuguese culinary traditions and local ingredients, resulting in innovative dishes that appeal to both locations and tourists. In addition, historians and gastronomic critics have played a crucial role in the documentation and promotion of the history of Portuguese cuisine in Macau. Its investigation provides valuable information on the evolution of culinary practices, helping to preserve heritage and ensure its future relevance. Geogostronomy analyzes the way geographical and cultural contexts shape food practices. In Macao, this perspective is evident in the cooking fusion that defines the region. Several traditional Portuguese dishes have been adapted using local seasonings, creating a unique version that reflects the identity of Macau and cannot be considered a copy or tampering. The influence of local spices and culinary techniques also led to the onset of macanese dishes, such as “Pork Chop Bun”, called the “Macanese version of the hamburger” and derived from “Bifana” and “African Chicken”, which is derived from the “Chicken to Piri Piri” that show the mixture of flavors and traditions. The role of spices in Macanese cuisine cannot be underestimated. The Portuguese settlers brought with them a wide variety of spices from their colonies, including black pepper, cinnamon and cloves. These flavors mingled with Chinese indigenous ingredients, giving rise to unique dishes that reflect both inheritances. For example, one of the most famous macanese dishes is Cod to Brás, a cod dish that integrates Portuguese techniques with local flavors such as garlic and onion. Another remarkable dish is the iconic Macaense Caril, which features Portuguese influences infused with spices that resemble Indian cuisine. The introduction of new cooking methods is an important aspect of this merger. Traditional Portuguese cuisine often involves techniques such as grilling, stewing and baking. These methods have been harmoniously mixed with Chinese methods, such as frying and steaming, creating a kitchen that is as diverse in preparation as in taste. Douts like the “Cabydela Duck”, a plate of duck in vinegar and served with rice, exemplify this mixture. The use of rice itself is noteworthy, as it is a basic food in both cultures, often prepared with techniques that enhance its flavor, such as frying with garlic before boiling. The adaptation of these dishes demonstrates the dynamic nature of culinary practices in response to geographical and cultural factors. The role of Portuguese cuisine goes beyond mere culinary practices; It plays a significant role in the formation of cultural identity and the economic development of Macao. The region's rich cooking supply has become a vital part of its tourist industry. Tourists looking for authentic experiences are often attracted to local restaurants that serve traditional Luso-Macaenses, thus supporting companies and the economy. In addition, the culinary landscape gained international recognition, with Macao receiving the title of UNESCO gastronomy city on October 31, 2017. This designation underlines the importance of preserving culinary heritage, simultaneously promoting its cultural meaning and its innovation potential. Highlights the need for sustainable practices in tourism and gastronomy sectors, ensuring that Macao's unique flavors continue to prosper. In recent years, Macao's culinary scene has recorded significant changes due to Covid-19 pandemic, globalization and the alteration of consumer preferences. (continues)

item.title: Australia interdicts social networks to children under 16 (III)
item.description: In the last two weeks, we have been analyzing the Australian Senate's decision to approve the change to the 2024 Internet (minimum age for access to social networks) law on November 28, 2024, which interdicts access to Networks to children under 16. The contents of the new law are simple, but from an operational point of view, there are many issues that deserve to be discussed. The two main questions are as follows, in the first place, neither infrastructors nor their legal guardians are not penalized in the light of the new law, the penalty is only about companies that generate social networks. This approach can lead to disputes on the attribution of responsibility when put into practice. Secondly, the new law requires companies that generate social networks to take measures to verify the age of users. However, the new law clearly stipulates that users cannot carry in these platforms the identification documents, which makes the correct determination of their age difficult. A goal spokesman stated that Facebook respects Australian law, but is concerned about the process adopted, as it considers that the law was accelerated to ensure the interdiction of children's access to social networks without being heard to different opinions on the subject. Since currently there is no more effective method to prevent children from using social networks, to solve the problem, the Australian government has stated that it would adopt the “age certification system”. It is planned to invite 1,200 Australian citizens to take an age evaluation test, and a consulting firm will implement recommendations in the middle of this year. This will be one of the largest tests with age assessment technology ever performed. If successful, it will become an important reference indicator for legislative agencies and technological platforms around the world to detect the age of users of social networks. It will be a highly representative global model and will be congratulated. But if it fails, will Australia have an alternative plan to enforce the new law? Although not mentioned in the news, from the point of view of public administration, it would be complicated to have a completely new computer system of unknown effectiveness to deal with the social problems arising from the access of children under 16 to social networks, the which is undoubtedly a risk. If prepared for both scenarios Australia will be easier to implement the new law. When it is necessary to verify the age of the users, the most effective method is through the presentation of identity cards, passports, etc. In Australia this method is not legal, possibly because photos and identification data are personal information and involve privacy protection issues. When companies that generate social networks receive accurate information, they can correctly determine the age of users, but at the same time, as they have access to many data from users, they have to treat them carefully. In light of the new law, companies that generate social networks can avoid these problems because they will not have to process the personal data of users, and they do not need to worry about the possibility of their data being disclosed, stolen or sold by third parties . Moreover, in relation to the practical and operational aspects of the new law, there is another issue that is concerned with online game. The children under 16 are students of basic education. Young people in this age group have no self-control and self-preservation capacity yet and easily addicted to the online universe. They are very dependent on social networking platforms and online games. Australian Prime Minister Anthony Albanese said that excessive use of social networks is a risk to the physical and mental health of children and that legislation should be introduced to control this risk. If Australia has passed legislation to protect the physical and mental health of children under 16, is the next step prevent them from playing online? On October 25, 2019, the management of the Press and Publications of Continental China issued the “National Press Administration Warning and Publications for Prevention of Addiction in Online Games among the Minors”, stipulating that all online game companies can only Have games available on Fridays, Saturdays, Sundays and holidays. These days, the games are available for one hour from 20.00 to 21.00, and no service will be available at other times. This regulation was actually applied in mainland China. On the other hand, South Korea passed a law in 2011 to restrict access from under 16 to online play between 22.30 and 6.00, but the law was very contested and was eventually repealed because it did not respect the rights of younger people . The new Australian law recognizes the risks that social networks pose for children's physical and mental health. If young people start using social networks too early, they are subject to adverse consequences such as depression, harassment, anxiety and weak academic results. If you continue to evolve into “internet addiction”, it will be even more serious and inevitable to legislate. The question of restricting children's access to online games can be seen as continuing the restriction of children's access to social networks and can be treated in the same way. The experience of mainland China in this area may be valuable to other countries. Hong Kong and Macao currently have no legislation that regulates access from under 16 to social networks or online game platforms. Do we need legislation to regulate these issues? The new Australian law is a warning to remind us of this problem. What should we do? Each of these regions can conduct an in -depth investigation and decide according to their conclusions. Next week we will have a new theme. item.title: Robert De Niro debuts on television on the conspiracy thriller “day zero”
item.description: The new miniseries "Day Zero" on Netflix marks the debut of Oscarized actor Robert de Niro on television, in a thriller in which he plays an former US president called to discover the authors of a devastating cyberthyrach. "The argument was so good, not even needed prior preparation," said the actor, at a press conference of the series in which Lusa participated. “The dialogue was excellent. It might have been pier, pretentious or biased, but in this case I wouldn't be here. ” “Day Zero” was filmed over seven months in New York, with Robert de Niro being critical to this location. "For some time I had spoken to my agent about doing anything in New York," said the actor, who is also a six -episode miniseries producer. The cast includes Angela Bassett, Matthew Modine, Jesse Plemons, Lizzy Caplan, Connie Britton and Joan Allen. Created by Eric Newman (“Griselda”, “Narcos: Mexico”), Noah Oppenheim (former president of NBC News) and Michael Schmidt (journalist), the miniseries departs from a massive cyberataque that turns off in the United States for a minute and causes chaos and thousands of dead. Robert De Niro plays former President George Mullen, called by current President Evelyn Mitchell (Angela Bassett) to preside over a committee to which unheard of investigation powers are given. The director Lesli Linka Glatter ("West Wing", "Homeland") described the series as "a paranoic conspiracy thriller." "The idea came from conversations about our relationship with the truth," said Eric Newman at the conference. "It's something global: we have entered a post-truth age where truths can be mutually exclusive." One of Mullen's antagonists is the author of a podcast, Evan Green (Dan Stevens) who plays with suspicions and throws accusations without proof to monetize the hearing's ultrasound. "Green represents the bangs that operates around a story like this," said the actor. "He is annoying, a divisive figure who thrives with division and makes it his coin." But the argument does not take a position and none of the interveners comes out particularly well, with a varied range of doubtful decisions, except for former President Sheila Mullen's wife, who maintains integrity. "What we hope that people will take this is that, although the mechanisms by which we determine the truth can be broken, perhaps irreparably, it is still possible to do the right thing," said Newman. "Although it is a disconcerting view of humanity, in the end there is a certain optimism and hope." Cocriador Noah Oppenheim said the team started working in this story several years ago and that it is amazing to see how what has happened in the real world mirrors the chaos that the series portrays. "If we think about the threats we face, be it cybership, climate change or nuclear war, the largest of all is the inability to agree with a shared set of facts," he said. Angela Bassett, who plays President Mitchell, stressed the importance of “seeing this representation of a woman” as the actress “in a place of power in the oval room”, something that excited her to do the series, besides being the second time to work with de niro. Also Connie Britton, who gives body to Valerie Whitesell, found the humanization of highly political situations interesting, which often forget that behind power positions are human beings with complex relationships and personalities. "This shows us how our choices can have an impact on everyone," he said while the characters try to maintain decorum and respect the high positions. "These acts of balance are what we do in real life, even if we are not in high risk espionage or cybership," he continued. "We are all trying to find a balance between our responsibilities and intimate relationships."

item.title: Hong Kong and Moma M+ Museum sign first collaboration
item.description: The Hong Kong M+ Museum has signed a collaboration agreement with the New York Modern Art Museum (MoMA), the first of the genre between the US institution and an Asian counterpart. The alliance, announced yesterday by the Hong Kong South China Morning Post newspaper, comes in the midst of growing geopolitical tensions between the United States and China. M+ assured the newspaper that on Tuesday signed a memorandum of understanding with MoMA, to promote cooperation in areas such as research, curators exchange, conservation, programs and talent development. The partnership takes place in the midst of the deterioration of Beijing and Washington, exacerbated by the return to the US Presidency on January 20, from Donald Trump, which imposed an additional 10% tariff on Hong Kong imports and mainland China China imports . Founded in 1929, MoMA houses a collection of nearly 200,000 pieces, which includes striking paintings in art history such as 'The Night Star Dark' by Vincent Van Gogh (1853-1890), and 'Les Demoiselles d'Avignon', by Pablo Picasso (1881-1973). Picasso in Raehk From March 15 to July 13, M+ will host the exhibition 'Picasso For Asia: The Conversation', which brings together more than 60 works by the Spanish artist, considered one of the most prolific and influential creators of the twentieth century. M+joint curatorship, located in the West Kowloon Cultural District, and the Musée National Picasso-Paris in France, this exhibition will be the first to display masterpieces from the Parisian museum alongside pieces from a museum collection in Asia. Among the prominent works that will be transported to the former British colony are 'The Acrobat' (1930), 'Figures by the Seaside' (1931), 'Great Great Nature with Pedestal Table' (1931), '' Portrait of Dora Maar '(1937) or' Massacre in Korea '(1951). The Hong Kong government pointed to the recovery of tourism as essential for the economy of the Chinese semi -autonomous region. Authorities said the organization of this exhibition represents an important step in restoring the city's cultural landscape and attracting visitors from around the world. The Hong Kong executive revealed a five -year tourist development plan, with the aim of almost duplicating the sector's contribution to Gross Domestic Product (GDP), from 2.6% in 2024 to about 5% by 2029. The plan, presented at the end of December by the Secretary for Culture, Sport and Tourism, Rosanna Law Shuk-Pui, includes the implementation of 133 measures focused on the creation of projects that highlight the city's local and international characteristics. Rosanna Law was appointed in early December by executive head John Lee Ka-Chiu at the first remodeling of the Hong Kong government, a neighboring city of Macau, since the former deputy commissioner of the police took office in July 2022, in the middle of pandemic.

item.title: Cinema | “Nezha 2” surpasses “Inside Out 2” at the box office
item.description: The Chinese animation movie “Nezha 2” exceeded the movie “Inside Out 2” (Pixar) and became the longest-and-box animation feature in history, the Chinese press said yesterday. With a global revenue of 12.3 billion Yuan, the film is also the eighth cinematic work with the highest box office of all time, according to the Yicai news portal. The success of “Nezha 2” is particularly remarkable for its origin, with more than 99 percent of revenues to come exclusively from China, unlike Hollywood productions, which depend strongly on international distribution. This sequel, which follows the story of “Nezha” (2019), is inspired by the sixteenth-century Chinese classic novel “The Investiture of the Gods”, which tells the adventures of a boy with magical powers that defends the Frequent City of Chentangguan. Launched on January 29, during the Lunar New Year, “Nezha 2” led the daily box office in China for 21 consecutive days, contributing significantly to the increase of the national box office. The phenomenon of this feature film led to an extension of the debut in movie theaters until March 30. Nezha's legacy as an iconic character of the Chinese animation will be honored at a special session on March 18 in Shanghai, where “Nezha conquers the Dragon King” (1979) and “Nezha 2” will be shown. This event will bring together two generations of spectators and will offer a perspective on the evolution of Chinese animation in the last four decades, as well as the continuity of myth in popular culture. Held by Yang Yu (known as Jiaozi), from Sichuan Province (Center of China), “Nezha 2” reflects the growing presence of Chinese animation films in the international film industry.

item.title: DSEC | Restoration and retail record new breaks in sales
item.description: Restaurant sales showed a 5.6 percent reduction in December 2024 compared to the same period. The figures are contained in the inquiry of conjuncture to restoration and retail trade performed by the Directorate of Statistics and Census Services (DSEC). Chinese food restaurants were the most affected by reducing sales volume with breaks that reached 10.3 percent. Western food restaurants also registered less sales, with a 4.4 percent decrease, compared to December 2023. At the opposite pole, within a year, restaurants with Japanese and Korean food showed increased sales of 10 , 9 percent. Breaks in sales between December last year and December 2023 were not limited to restoration. In retail trade the situation was no better. According to the interviewees by DSEC, the breaks in sales reached 21.1 percent in annual terms. Watch and jewelery businesses were the most affected with a 31.5 percent sales reduction, while sales of leather items had a 25.9 percent reduction. The sale of goods in warehouses and trinkets fell 20.8 percent. On the other hand, the sale of cars grew 36 percent compared to the same period.

item.title: Tourism | January recorded more than three million visitors
item.description: Macao received in January almost 3.65 million visitors, 27.4 percent than in the same month of 2024 and the second highest value ever, was announced yesterday. According to official data, the number of tourists who passed through the territory was only exceeded by August, which recorded more than 3.65 million visitors. However, according to the direction of statistics and census services, more than 59 percent of visitors (2.16 million) arrived on organized excursions and spent less than one day in the city. In 2024, the central government released a series of measures to support Macau, such as the increase in the tax exemption limit of goods for personal use acquired by visitors from China. At the same time, Chinese authorities widened 10 other cities in China the list of places with “individual visas” to visit Hong Kong and Macau. Also, since January 1 that residents of the neighboring city of Zhuhai can visit Macau once a week and stay up to seven days. As a result, the overwhelming majority (91.3 percent) of tourists who arrived in Macao in January came from mainland China or Hong Kong, while only 241,000 were international visitors. An almost record January was close to setting a new record, despite the number of people who visited Macau during the so -called Golden Week of the Lunar year was 3.5 percent lower than in the same period of holidays of 2024. According to data from the Macao Public Security Police, between January 28 and February 4, 1.31 million tourists entered the region, a daily average of 163,700. On January 17, Macau's Director of Tourism Services (STD), Maria Helena de Senna Fernandes, said she expected a daily average of 185,000 visitors during the 'Golden Week'. On the same day, Senna Fernandes said Portugal could help Macau attract more visitors from the rest of Europe. The leader gave as an example the semi -sectional meeting of the European Confederation of Travel Agency Associations and Tour Operators (ECTAA), which will be held in Macao in June. “It was through APAVT [Portuguese Association of Travel and Tourism Agencies] that we were presented to ECTAA,” said Senna Fernandes. "Although it will have less than 100 people, they represent 80,000 travel agencies from all over Europe in all," said the leader. Senna Fernandes also said he hopes that Macau could receive between 38 and 39 million visitors this year. In August, the leader pointed to more than three million international visitors in 2025. Macau received last year 34.9 million visitors, 23.8 percent than the previous year, but still far from the 39.4 million record set in 2019, before the pandemic.

item.title: Human Trafficking | Beijing defends collaboration with Thailand and Myanmar in the fight against crime
item.description: China reaffirmed yesterday the intention to collaborate with Thailand and Myanmar in the fight against human trafficking networks after the Thai authorities began to repatty Chinese citizens held in captive by criminal groups. “China follows its people -centered philosophy. It is a necessary choice to safeguard the common interests of the region's countries and respond to aspirations shared by their peoples, ”said Chinese Foreign Ministry spokesman Guo Jiakun at a press conference. Guo stressed that China maintains close bilateral and multilateral cooperation with Thailand, Myanmar and other affected countries. “We took several measures to solve both symptoms and the deep causes of these crimes and work together to prevent criminals from crossing borders, with the aim of eradicating the problem of illegal online fraud and gambling,” he said. The spokesman added that China will continue to take steps to “protect people's life and goods” and preserve exchange and cooperation with countries in the region. However, it avoided giving details about the identity of repatriated citizens, their health or the circumstances of their rescue. "For specific information, I refer to the competent authorities in China," he said. Thailand yesterday began the repatriation of thousands of people, mostly Chinese citizens, who had been taken by criminal groups and exploited in centers dedicated to online fraud on Myanmar. The first of the planes took off yesterday with 50 passengers on board, although it is expected that a total of 1,041 Chinese will be sent to his country among the 7,000 foreigners to repact in the coming days, according to the estimate made by the Thai Prime Minister this week , Paetongtarn Shinawatra.

item.title: China | Synthesized a hexagonal diamond harder than the natural
item.description: A team of Chinese researchers was able to synthesize Lonsdaleita, a rare form of hexagonal diamond with a hardness 40 percent higher than the natural diamond. The discovery was made by scientists at the University of Jilin and Sun Yat-Sen University, China Daily said on Wednesday. The development group recently pointed out that Lonsdaleita was obtained from graffiti submitted to extreme pressure and temperature conditions. "The synthesis of Lonsdaleita has been a focal point of research for scientists around the world over the past 50 years," said Yao Mingguang, professor at the University of Jilin State Superduct Materials Laboratory. Lonsdaleita, discovered in 1967, is naturally formed in places of impact of meteorites, although its artificial synthesis was a challenge for the scientific community. To achieve it, Chinese researchers applied pressure of 300,000 atmospheres, six times higher than necessary to make conventional diamonds. As a result, they obtained crystals up to 1.2 mm in diameter, a size considerably larger than those obtained in previous attempts. In addition to its exceptional hardness, synthesized Lonsdaleita displays remarkable thermal stability, remaining stable up to 1,100 ° C. “Newly synthesized diamonds have thermal stability and remain stable at extreme temperatures,” explained Yao. This feature may allow its application to ultra-resistant and semiconductor materials. Despite the progress, industrial production is not yet viable: “Finding appropriate catalysts can make way for it,” said the investigator. The team now seeks to optimize the process to move from laboratory synthesis to manufacture in large volume.

item.title: China | Reference interest rate maintained at 3.1% for the fifth consecutive month
item.description: The Popular Bank of China announced yesterday that it will maintain the reference interest rate at 3.1 percent, for the fifth consecutive month, thus going to meet the expectations of analysts. In its monthly update, the institution indicated that the reference interest rate at one year (LPR) will remain at least until a month from now. This indicator, established as a reference for interest rates in 2019, is used to set the price of new loans - usually intended for companies - and loans the variable rate that are being reimbursed. It is calculated based on the price contributions of a set of banks - including small creditors that tend to have higher financing costs and higher mischief - and aims to lower loan costs and support the “real economy”. The last reduction was in October last year, when the Central Bank reduced it to 25 base points from 3.35 percent. The institution also indicated yesterday that the interest rate for more than five years - the reference for mortgage loans - will remain 3.6 percent, also in accordance with analysts' predictions. The last descent occurred in October, also in 25 base points, from 3.85 percent.

item.title: Hong Kong | Inflation rises to 2% in January due to the new year lunar
item.description:
Food and transport seem to have been the main factors of acceleration of inflation last month when the arrival of the new Lunar year was celebrated
Inflation in the Chinese Semiautonoma region of Hong Kong accelerated in January, for the first time since August, due to transportation and food prices during the holidays of the Lunar New Year, was announced yesterday. The Consumer Price Index (IPC) rose 2 percent in January, compared to the same period, said the Hong Kong Census and Statistics Department (CSD). In December, inflation settled at 1.4 percent. In a statement, the CSD justified the acceleration, the first in five months, with "the price increases in round trip transportation and background and basic food prices due to the effect of the Chinese New Year." The Lunar New Year, the largest mass movement in the world, is the main traditional party of Chinese families and takes place in January or February, depending on the lunar calendar. This year, he celebrated between January 28 and February 4. The CSD also stressed that a 10 percent increase in the income of most residents in public housing in Hong Kong, a neighboring city of Macau. A territory government spokesman argued that underlying consumer price inflation was modest in January and added that, overall, food prices "continued to record mild annual increases." In a statement, the spokesman predicted that inflation "should remain moderate in the short term," but admitted that "uncertainties arising from geopolitical tensions and commercial conflicts deserve attention." Inflated future In early February, the new US President Donald Trump announced an additional 10 percent rate on Hong Kong and mainland China imports. Inflation in China also accelerated in January, for the first time since August, due to the strong increase in family spending, at the time of New Year's holidays, contrary to persistent deflationist pressures. The Consumer Price Index (IPC) rose 0.5 percent in January, compared to the same period, the National Statistics Office (NBS) in the Asia reported on February 9. In December, inflation settled at 0.1 percent. The temporary increase in consumption briefly checked the size of the deflait challenge that the world's second largest economy faces. The price of services increased by 0.9 percent, representing more than half of the total IPC increase, according to NBS. The deflation in China factories extended for the 28th consecutive month, with a decline of 2.3 percent, remaining stable, compared to the contraction of the index in December. Domestic consumption is increasingly crucial and so the Chinese government has already advanced plans to increase public spending and reduce interest rates. Beijing's fear is that a rooted price cycle of pricing can bark household expenses and push companies to salary and discharge cuts.

item.title: Ukraine | Seoul will welcome North Korean soldiers who want to desert
item.description: South Korean authorities admitted yesterday to welcome the North Korean soldiers who are captured in Ukraine fight along with the Russian troops and want to desert from North Korea. The South Korea Foreign Ministry has advanced in a statement that "North Korean soldiers are South Korean citizens according to the Constitution" so that "respecting the will of these people is to fulfill international law." The South Korean government announcement was made following the latest reports that many North Korean soldiers were injured during the conflict after being sent to support Russia under the strategic defense agreement reached last year between the president Russian, Vladimir Putin, and North Korean leader Kim Jong Un. The Ukrainian authorities announced the capture of two North Korean soldiers who fought alongside the Russian troops in the Russian province of Kursk, where Kiev launched a military operation last summer. The Ukrainian government proposed to return them to North Korea if Pyongyang agrees to facilitate an exchange with Ukrainian soldiers currently detained in Russia. Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky estimated that about 4,000 North Korean soldiers were killed or injured in Kursk, although the number was not verified. The availability presented by the South Korean government arises after a soldier said in an interview with the Chosun Ilbo newspaper, which plans to ask for asylum in South Korea. The Ministry of Seoul reacted, arguing that these people “should not be sent back to a place where they face the threat of persecution. ”

item.title: Huawei | Analysts highlight victory against restrictions after release of a new model
item.description: Analysts considered Tuesday that the international launch of the new three-screen Huawei mobile phone represents a symbolic victory for the Chinese technological giant, which has been the target of heavy restrictions from the United States. At the release event in Kuala Lumpur, the group reported that Huawei Mate XT consists of three screen, doubled twice and is the thinnest folding phone, with a 25.4mm screen, similar to an iPad da American Apple. “At this time, Huawei is the only innovative in triple screen design models,” said Bryan Ma, analyst at the International Data Corporation Market Research Company. Huawei has achieved this position although it does not have access to advanced semiconductors or Google services, by imposition of the US government. "All these things have been basically big obstacles to Huawei," Ma said, adding that the "resurgence we are seeing is a victory." Huawei, China's first global technology brand, is at the center of a US Battle - China for the domain of commerce and technology. In 2019, Washington cut Huawei access to US components and technology, including Google and other mobile phones. It also prevented global suppliers from using US technology to produce components for the company. US authorities have considered Huawei to pose a safety risk, which the company has denied. The Government of China has accused Washington of inappropriately using the concept of national security to contain a competitor on the rise of US technological companies. Huawei announced Mate XT on September 20 last year, the same day Apple launched its iPhone 16 series in global markets. At the Kuala Lumpur event, Huawei also introduced its Matepad Pro tablet and Free Arc, its first open auriculars, and other portable devices.

item.title: Real Estate | New houses prices remain falling
item.description: The prices of new houses in China fell for the twentieth consecutive month in January, it was announced yesterday, despite the measures adopted by the government to stimulate the sector, which is dipped in a prolonged crisis. Prices in the 70 main cities of the country fell 0.07 percent, compared to the previous month, according to calculations made from the figures released by the Chinese National Statistics Office (GNE). In December, the price of new houses registered a contraction of 0.08 percent. The calculations made based on GNE data also reflect a 0.34 percent reduction in the price of secondhand houses in January, after decreasing 0.31 percent in the last month of 2024. In recent months, Chinese authorities have announced measures to wrap the real estate market, an issue that worries Beijing, due to the implications for social stability, as housing is one of the main investment vehicles of Chinese families. One of the main causes of the recent softening of the Chinese economy is precisely the crisis of the real estate sector, whose weight in national GDP - adding the indirect factors - was estimated at about 30 percent, according to some analysts.

item.title: Vietname will build railway connection by the China border
item.description: Vietnam approved yesterday the construction of a railway line connecting the Haiphong Port to Hanoi and the China border, with a cost of over eight billion dollars. The railway between the northern coast of Vietnam and the region bordering Yunnan's Chinese province aims to reinforce links between the two border countries and facilitate trade. The new connection will serve Vietname's main factories, where Samsung, Foxconn, Pegatron and other world electronics giants are located, many of which depend on regular charges for components from China. About 390 kilometers long, the connection will start from the port city of Haiphong to Lao Cai, in the Vietname North mountainous north, on the Yunnan border via Hanoi. It replaces the old line in operation, built over a century during the period of French Indochina. China will finance part of the project through loans. During the visit of Chinese President Xi Jinping, Hanoi, in December 2023, the two countries signed more than thirty agreements. The new line will “boost economic, commercial, investment and tourist cooperation between the two countries,” said Vietnamese Foreign Ministry spokesman Pham Thu Hang last week. The new railway connection can help to mitigate the difficulties of international supply routes caused by the current dependence on slow and expensive trucks, which are “prone to strangulation on the border,” explained Dan Martin, a consulting firm expert Dezan Shira & Associates. "China provides a large part of Vietnam's industrial sector that feeds the industrial sector and it is essential to maintain this system stable," said the analyst, quoted by France-Presse. "A modern rail connection eliminates inefficiencies and ensures transport without problems of goods, whether sent to Vietnamese factories or world markets through Haiphong Port," he added. Another line for China, which has not yet been approved by Parliament, will eventually connect Hanoi to the province of Lang Son, which borders the Chinese Guangxi region, through another vast area where foreign factories are found. Vietname also provides for the construction of a high -speed railway line to connect Hanoi to the city of Ho Chi Minh, the economic capital of the southern, with an estimated cost of $ 67 billion, with the aim of reducing the travel time of 30 hours for about five hours.

HM talked to António Queirós before the lecture on the subject he gave yesterday at the Macau Scientific and Cultural Center in Lisbon

China's fundamental thesis is that all regimes can collaborate in building a new civilization, but this implies outdoor democratic reforms that are consigned in global civilization proposals, guaranteeing peace according to the principle of indivisibility of security. But I would like to point out the moment when the United Nations (UN), representing the whole world, became aware of the existence of an environmental crisis, from the Stockholm Conference, which took place in 1972. It is not discussed why the West there is great ignorance about China and the reality of the country. The only advantage I have about most people who write and talk about China is that my relationship with the country is over 50 years old. I know how China was presented to the West 50 years ago. We lived [in Portugal], a fascist regime where information came to people with great difficulty. I have seen these years to all kinds of visions about China that lacked concrete information, because the country, until reform and openness, was a closed society. But this lack of information was general in the West. I also had visions that were not reality and I began to question myself if China's historical experience is unique, without parallel in the history of society, democracy and socialism, for its historical characteristics, hermeneutics, in the sense of method, analysis, analysis of concepts and starting points, which predominates the West, does not serve. But then let's go to the concrete issue, which is the responsibilities that China has in environmental matters.
